<!-- commit: 7a91757140d3ec99cb4e260733c9b0f36cce4987 -->
<!-- generated_at: 2025-11-17T09:43:06Z -->
# Platform: React Native

## /
- [Readme](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/README.md): High-level README describing the Notifly React Native SDK package, including installation commands for npm/yarn, supported platforms (iOS/Android), and links to the official English and Korean client SDK documentation as the primary integration guide.
- [Changelog](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/CHANGELOG.md): Documents the SDK’s versioned changes (features, fixes, platform support updates, and new public APIs like `getNotiflyUserId()`) following Keep a Changelog and Semantic Versioning, serving as the authoritative history for release notes and upgrade impact assessment.
- [Package](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/package.json): Defines the Notifly React Native SDK npm package metadata, build/packaging outputs (CommonJS, ES module, TypeScript), React Native entrypoint, and development tooling (tests, linting, type-checking, release automation) via react-native-builder-bob and release-it configuration.
- [Tsconfig](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/tsconfig.json): Configures TypeScript compilation for the SDK, defining strict type-checking options, ESNext/React targets, Node-style module resolution, JSON/module interop, and a path alias mapping the public `notifly-sdk` entry point to `src/index`.
- [Tsconfig.build](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/tsconfig.build.json): Configures the build-specific TypeScript settings by extending the base `tsconfig` and excluding the `example` directory from compilation, ensuring only SDK source files are emitted in production builds.
- [Babel.config](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/babel.config.js): Babel configuration file that applies the `metro-react-native-babel-preset` preset to transpile the React Native SDK source code for Metro bundler compatibility.
- [Jest.config](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/jest.config.js): Configures Jest for the React Native SDK, using the `react-native` preset and excluding tests under `example/node_modules` and the built `lib` directory via `modulePathIgnorePatterns`.
- [](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/.npmrc): Configures npm to save exact dependency versions (no caret/tilde ranges) for this project, ensuring deterministic installations across environments when adding or updating packages used by the React Native SDK.
- [](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/.nvmrc): Specifies Node.js runtime version 20.
- [](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/.eslintIgnore): ESLint ignore configuration specifying generated and configuration artifacts (`node_modules/`, `lib/`, `.prettierrc`) that should be excluded from linting for this React Native SDK.
- [](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/.eslintrc): Configures ESLint for the project root by extending the React Native and Prettier rule sets, enforcing consistent code style and linting behavior across the React Native SDK source files.
- [Notifly React Native Sdk](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/notifly_react_native_sdk.podspec): Defines the CocoaPods specification for the `notifly_react_native_sdk` React Native iOS bridge, wiring ios/* sources to the `notifly_sdk` (v2.1.

## android/src/main/java/tech/notifly/rn
- [Notiflysdkpackage](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/android/src/main/java/tech/notifly/rn/NotiflySdkPackage.kt): Defines the `NotiflySdkPackage` TurboReactPackage that registers and exposes the `NotiflySdkModule` to React Native, configuring its ReactModuleInfo (constants, eager init, C++ usage, TurboModule flag via `BuildConfig.IS_NEW_ARCHITECTURE_ENABLED`).
- [Notiflysdkutils](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/android/src/main/java/tech/notifly/rn/NotiflySdkUtils.kt): Provides utility converters for the React Native bridge, transforming `HashMap<String, Any>` and Notifly push objects (`INotificationClickEvent`, `IPushNotification`) into `WritableMap`/`HashMap` structures suitable for JS consumption, including notification metadata, custom data, and payload fields.
- [Notiflysdkmodule](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/android/src/main/java/tech/notifly/rn/NotiflySdkModule.kt): Kotlin React Native bridge module (`NotiflyReactNativeSdk`) that wraps the core `Notifly` Android SDK, exposing initialization, user identity/properties, event tracking, logging, in-app message control, and notification click listener registration via `@ReactMethod` APIs and JS device events.

## android/src/newarch
- [Notiflysdkspec](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/android/src/newarch/NotiflySdkSpec.kt): Defines the abstract `NotiflySdkSpec` class extending `NativeNotiflyReactNativeSdkSpec` to provide the new architecture React Native module base for the Notifly SDK, wiring it to a `ReactApplicationContext` for bridged native functionality.

## android/src/oldarch
- [Notiflysdkspec](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/android/src/oldarch/NotiflySdkSpec.kt): Defines the abstract React Native bridge module for the old Android architecture, specifying JS-exposed Notifly APIs for SDK initialization, user identity/properties, event tracking, log level configuration, in-app message control, and notification click listener registration via Promise-based methods.

## example
- [React Native.config](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/example/react-native.config.js): Configures React Native to treat this example app’s local package (`..
- [Jest.config](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/example/jest.config.js): Jest configuration for the example app, setting the test preset to `react-native` to enable React Native–specific testing behavior and environment setup.
- [Index](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/example/index.js): Bootstraps the React Native example app by initializing the `notifly-sdk` with env credentials, configuring Android log level, setting and logging the Notifly user ID, registering a notification click listener, and registering `AppWrapper` as the root component.
- [Metro.config](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/example/metro.config.js): Metro bundler configuration for the example app that merges default settings, enforces single-instance peerDependencies via blacklist/extraNodeModules aliases, sets custom projectRoot/watchFolders, and configures transformer options for inline requires and non-experimental imports.
- [Babel.config](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/example/babel.config.js): Babel configuration for the example app, wiring the React Native preset, resolving the local SDK source via `module-resolver` using `package.json` metadata, and loading environment variables into `@env` via `module:react-native-dotenv`.

## example/android/app/src/debug/java/com/notiflysdkexample
- [Reactnativeflipper](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/example/android/app/src/debug/java/com/notiflysdkexample/ReactNativeFlipper.java): Debug-only utility that initializes Flipper for the example app, registering inspector, database, shared preferences, crash reporter, network (via NetworkingModule/OkHttp interceptor), and Fresco plugins when `initializeFlipper(Context, ReactInstanceManager)` is invoked.

## example/android/app/src/main/java/com/notiflysdkexample
- [Mainapplication](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/example/android/app/src/main/java/com/notiflysdkexample/MainApplication.java): Android `Application` entry point configuring the React Native host/ReactHost (packages via `PackageList`, JS main module, dev support, Hermes/new architecture flags), initializing SoLoader with merged SO mapping, and loading `DefaultNewArchitectureEntryPoint` when enabled.
- [Mainactivity](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/example/android/app/src/main/java/com/notiflysdkexample/MainActivity.java): Android entry activity for the Notifly SDK example app, wiring the `NotiflySdkExample` React Native component via `ReactActivity`, and configuring `DefaultReactActivityDelegate` to toggle Fabric and Concurrent React using `DefaultNewArchitectureEntryPoint` flags.

## example/android/app/src/release/java/com/notiflysdkexample
- [Reactnativeflipper](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/example/android/app/src/release/java/com/notiflysdkexample/ReactNativeFlipper.java): Provides the no-op release implementation of `ReactNativeFlipper.initializeFlipper(Context, ReactInstanceManager)`, ensuring Flipper debug tooling is not initialized or bundled in the Android release build of the React Native example app.

## example/ios
- [File](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/example/ios/File.swift): Placeholder Swift file in the iOS example app target; currently contains no logic, APIs, or side effects beyond importing Foundation and can be safely ignored or removed unless used for future Swift-based example code.

## example/ios/NotiflyNotificationExtension
- [Notificationservice](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/example/ios/NotiflyNotificationExtension/NotificationService.swift): Implements the iOS notification service extension by subclassing `NotiflyNotificationServiceExtension`, initializing the Notifly push SDK, and registering the extension with a hard-coded `projectId` and `username` for handling incoming rich push notifications.

## example/ios/NotiflySdkExample
- [Main](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/example/ios/NotiflySdkExample/main.m): Entry point for the iOS example app, initializing the UIKit application lifecycle by invoking `UIApplicationMain` with `AppDelegate` as the primary application delegate class.
- [Appdelegate](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/example/ios/NotiflySdkExample/AppDelegate.mm): Objective-C React Native AppDelegate that bootstraps the NotiflySdkExample app, configures Firebase and notification center delegation, forwards APNs/UNUserNotificationCenter events to the Notifly Swift bridge, handles deep-link URLs via RCTLinkingManager, and resolves the JS bundle URL with concurrent React 18 root enabled.

## example/ios/NotiflySdkExampleTests
- [Notiflysdkexampletests](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/example/ios/NotiflySdkExampleTests/NotiflySdkExampleTests.m): Defines an XCTestCase that boots the React Native root view, intercepts RCTLog errors, and recursively scans the UIKit view hierarchy to assert the "Welcome to React" accessibility label renders within TIMEOUT_SECONDS, restoring the default log function afterward.

## example/src
- [Webviewapp](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/example/src/WebviewApp.js): Example React Native screen that disables notifly in-app messages on mount and renders a configurable test web page via `react-native-webview`, with a button to switch app mode back to the main screen using the provided `setAppMode` callback.
- [Loginpage](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/example/src/LoginPage.js): Example React Native login screen that fetches and displays the FCM token via `@react-native-firebase/messaging`, tracks a `loginpage_visit` event with `notifly.trackEvent`, and exposes navigation/app-mode entry points via `navigation.
- [Appwrapper](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/example/src/AppWrapper.js): Top-level React component that toggles between the main `App` and `WebviewApp` UIs based on internal `appMode` state, passing `setAppMode` as a prop to let children control which experience is rendered.
- [Homepage](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/example/src/HomePage.js): Example React Native `HomePage` screen that demonstrates integrating `notifly-sdk` by tracking multiple button-driven events via `notifly.trackEvent` and providing navigation entry points to `Login`, `MyPage`, and `EventPage` using React Navigation.
- [Eventpage](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/example/src/EventPage.js): React Native screen component that lets users compose an event name, dynamic key/value parameters, optional segmentation param keys, and invokes `notifly.trackEvent(eventName, eventParams, segmentationEventParamKeys)` with navigation back to the Home screen.
- [App](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/example/src/App.js): Root example app component that configures deep-linking-aware React Navigation stack (Login, Home, MyPage, EventPage), requests Firebase Cloud Messaging notification permission on mount, and exposes `setAppMode` via the `LoginPage` screen entry point.
- [Mypage](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/example/src/MyPage.js): Example React Native screen that demonstrates calling core `notifly-sdk` identity APIs (`setUserId`, `setUserProperties`, `setEmail`, `setPhoneNumber`, `setTimezone`) via form inputs, including removing the user ID and navigating back to the `Home` route.

## ios
- [Notiflysdk](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/ios/NotiflySdk.swift): Provides the React Native iOS bridge to the underlying `notifly_sdk`, exposing promise-based Objective-C methods for SDK initialization, user identification/profiles, contact info, timezone, event tracking with JSON parsing, in-app message disabling, and FCM token registration.
- [Notiflysdk](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/ios/NotiflySdk.m): Objective-C React Native bridge module declaration (`NotiflyReactNativeSdk`) exposing promise-based Notifly APIs for initialization, user identity/properties, contact/timezone configuration, event tracking with segmentation, retrieving the Notifly user ID, disabling in-app messages, and registering FCM tokens.

## src
- [Index](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/src/index.tsx): Entry point for the Notifly React Native SDK, exposing JS wrappers around the native module (TurboModule or `NativeModules.NotiflyReactNativeSdk`) for initialization, user identity/properties, event tracking, Android log level and notification click listeners, with iOS/Android payload handling differences.
- [Constants](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/src/constants.ts): Defines the `EventNames` enum containing the `Notifly#NotificationClicked` constant used as the canonical event identifier for notification click handling across the React Native SDK’s event-emitting and listener registration logic.
- [Nativenotiflyreactnativesdk](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/src/NativeNotiflyReactNativeSdk.ts): Defines the `NotiflyReactNativeSdk` TurboModule interface and native bridge, exposing initialization, user identity/property setters, event tracking with segmentation, log-level configuration, in-app messaging control, and notification click listener registration via `TurboModuleRegistry.getEnforcing`.

## src/__tests__
- [Index.test](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/src/__tests__/index.test.tsx): Placeholder Jest test file for `src/index` with a single `it.todo('write a test')`, indicating pending test coverage and no current runtime behavior or public API verification.

## src/events
- [Eventreceiver](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/src/events/EventReceiver.ts): Wraps the native Notifly `NativeModule` in a `NativeEventEmitter`, managing per-event listener arrays and transforming specific events (e.g.

## src/types
- [Notification](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/src/types/notification.ts): Defines core notification typing for the SDK, including `OSNotification`, `OSNotificationClickEvent`, `NotificationClickListener` callback signature, and `OSNotificationImportance` enum, used to describe payloads, metadata, and click events for Notifly push notifications (Android-specific fields included).
- [Index](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/team-michael/notifly-react-native-sdk/main/src/types/index.ts): Re-exports core notification types and defines shared SDK type contracts, including `InitializeParams` for client setup (project and credentials) and generic `UserProperties`/`EventProperties` maps used across Notifly React Native public APIs.
